examples: We need a peppermint palate cleanser.

words.defineEn: (anatomy) the inside upper side of the mouth that separates it from the nasal cavity
words.defineVi: (giải phẫu) mặt trong phía trên ngăn cách miệng với hốc mũi

words.defineEn: a flexible muscular structure located at the back of the roof of the mouth
words.defineVi: một cấu trúc cơ bắp linh hoạt nằm ở phía sau vòm miệng

examples: A swollen uvula is unpleasant.
For now, the uvula remains one of many odd quirks of the human body.
The uvula, soft palate, and tonsils are also the first lines of defense against bacteria and viruses invading our mouths.
The uvula hangs from the soft palate, the fleshy bit behind the roof of your mouth, which mainly stops food from going up your nose when you swallow.
Enlarged uvulas are also found in people who snore or suffer from obstructive sleep apnea, where sleep is interrupted by parts of the throat cutting off airflow at night.
words.defineEn: (anatomy) the soft fleshy part at the back of the soft palate that hangs just above the pharynx
words.defineVi: (giải phẫu) phần thịt mềm ở phía sau khẩu cái mềm treo ngay phía trên yết hầu

words.defineEn: the bony structure in the roof of the mouth that separates the oral and nasal cavities
words.defineVi: cấu trúc xương trong vòm miệng ngăn cách khoang miệng và mũi

examples: Tongues were wagging over their engagement.

I'm just biting my tongue for now.
words.defineEn: the soft movable part inside the mouth used for tasting something or speaking
words.defineVi: phần mềm di động bên trong miệng được sử dụng để nếm một cái gì đó hoặc nói

examples: Lots of other animals have baby teeth, too.

words.defineEn: any of the temporary teeth in young children that falls out and is later replaced with a permanent one

words.defineEn: (anatomy) any of the four pointed teeth that are between the incisors and premolars, used for tearing food

examples: Uneasy lies the head that wears the crown.

words.defineEn: the external part of the tooth outside the gum

examples: Eons enamel pins are available now!

and it's eroding the enamel and it can cause permanent damage.

words.defineEn: the hard white external layer that covers the crown of a tooth
words.defineVi: lớp ngoài cứng màu trắng bao phủ thân răng

examples: By gum, he's a big lad!

words.defineEn: the firm, pink flesh around the roots of teeth at the top and bottom of the mouth

words.defineEn: (anatomy) any of the eight narrow-edged teeth at the front of the mouth that are used for biting

examples: Some people also call them milk teeth or primary teeth.
words.defineEn: a temporary tooth in young children that drops out and is later replaced with a permanent one

examples: So these animals have molar teeth and really big incisors.

words.defineEn: one of the large flat teeth at the back of the mouth used for grinding and crushing food

examples: Unlike its ancestors, Archaeocyon had shorter jaws and thicker premolars.
While many therapsids have premolars and molars, this one didn’t.

The premolars are a little bit smaller than the molars, but all of these teeth have wide, bumpy surfaces instead of sharp edges.
These are your premolar and molar teeth.
words.defineEn: a tooth that is located between the canine and molar teeth
words.defineVi: một chiếc răng nằm giữa răng nanh và răng hàm

words.defineEn: a rounded ridge or prominence found on the lingual surface of anterior teeth near the cervical third

examples: That DJ's voice really sets my teeth on edge.

words.defineEn: one of the things in our mouth that are hard and white and we use to chew and bite food with
words.defineVi: một trong những thứ cứng và trắng trong miệng của chúng ta và chúng ta dùng để nhai và cắn thức ăn bằng

words.defineEn: a tooth located between the canine and molar teeth
words.defineVi: một chiếc răng nằm giữa răng nanh và răng hàm

examples: In 2008, a team of anthropologists studied the thickness of the enamel on ten Gigantopithecus teeth, as well as the shape of the hard tissue underneath it, called the dentin.

A dermal denticle is triangular and made of dentin, a hard tissue derived from the same cells as teeth.
words.defineEn: a hard, calcified tissue beneath the enamel and cementum of a tooth
words.defineVi: một mô cứng, vôi hóa bên dưới men răng và xi măng của răng

examples: She squeezed the orange, releasing the refreshing pulp into her glass.

words.defineEn: the soft, connective tissue found in the center of a tooth, containing blood vessels, nerves, and cells

words.defineEn: the third and final set of molars that typically emerge in the back of the mouth during early adulthood
